data.title: Starling.contextValid string allocations
Can't load assets since the last update (#502)
Error #3681: Texture size is zero - on asset manager
Big issue in asset manager
data.body:
https://github.com/bojamunje/AssetManagerBug

here is sample project.

If you load xml in asset manager in air with enqueue folder, later on if it happens that you have any error, it just catches the error in asset manager.

data.title: [IMPROVEMENT] - add rectangle, ellipse and polygon hit areas to DisplayObject
data.body:
Hi, 

 I am playing with starling mouse events, and hit detection.

I wrote small extension that adds possibility to define rectangle, ellipse(bounded by Rectangle) and polygon(Vector of Points) as hit zone for object. 

 I wondering if it would be good idea to add it to starling.display.DisplayObject hitTest function.

this is how it looks in action : https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/63040685/StarlingExpressTestMain.swf.zip

white rectangles are starling Images, with different hit test areas defined. 
(it also have one flash and one starling sprite as violet rectangles)

WIP Implementation looks something like this : https://github.com/MindScriptAct/as3-signalsExpress/blob/master/src/mindscriptact/starlingSignals/display/SpriteStarlingExtendedExpress.as

 I would like to have it for all starling display objects, so it makes the most sense to move it into DisplayObject level.

 Performance wise, it would add one extra if function for current implementation, to check if hit test is customly defined or you should fall back to object bounding box.

Do you think it is good idea to have build in functionality to define custom hit area for starling objects?

data.title: Minor performance improvement on handling events. (one if removed) :
data.body:
- removed check if starling is started.
- ensured events are not listened if starling is not started.

data.title: Hover is fired, after click, but mouse is not moved.
data.body:
Hi,

 For whatever strange reasons if you click on object you get 2 Events instead of one:
"ended" and "hover".

"hover" should not be sent unless mouse is actually moved.

data.title: Supporting different size textures in Button.as
data.body:
Currently, if you programmatically swap texture A with texture B for the upstate (or any other state) of a Starling button, texture B gets resized to the same size of texture A.

Instead, it would be very useful to have the ability to swap texture without constraining the size of the upstate texture to the first texture used when creating the button.

For example I use a button in my game that, while triggering the same action, has a different look (texture) for each game mode. And this texture need to be of different size for each game mode.

The same effect can be achieved by creating 2 different buttons of course, but naturally that would create an unnecessary overhead.

data.title: Right mouse button down/up event handling added.
data.body: Maps Right mouse clicks to to TouchEvent.RIGHT_DOWN and TouchEvent.RIGHT_UP.

data.title: Out of bounds Error in VertexData (getAlpha() and copyTransformedTo()) methods.
data.body:
I'm receiving some uncaught errors on my Android version of the game with the code id 1125 (out of bounds). I'm not sure why is only happening on Android, but I get lots of these reports. Both methods there are referencing the mRawData vector so I guess that's the problem. I'm afraid I can not give anymore information since this only happened on the production build and I'm unable to reproduce the error debugging. These are the two stack traces:

```
RangeError: Error 1125 at starling.utils::VertexData/copyTransformedTo() at 
starling.display::QuadBatch/addQuadBatch() at 
starling.core::RenderSupport/batchQuadBatch() at 
starling.display::QuadBatch/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.text::TextField/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.display::Sprite/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.display::Sprite/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.display::Sprite/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.core::Starling/render() at 
starling.core::Starling/nextFrame()\n\tat Main/onEnterFrame() at 
flash.events::EventDispatcher/dispatchEvent() at 
away3d.core.managers::Stage3DProxy/notifyEnterFrame() at 
away3d.core.managers::Stage3DProxy/onEnterFrame()
```

```
RangeError: Error #1125\n\tat starling.utils::VertexData/getAlpha() at 
starling.utils::VertexData/scaleAlpha()\n\tat starling.display::QuadBatch/addQuad() at 
starling.core::RenderSupport/batchQuad()\n\tat starling.display::Image/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.display::Sprite/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.display::Sprite/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.display::Sprite/render() at 
starling.display::DisplayObjectContainer/render()\n\tat starling.core::Starling/render() at 
starling.core::Starling/nextFrame()\n\tat Main/onEnterFrame() at 
flash.events::EventDispatcher/dispatchEvent() at 
away3d.core.managers::Stage3DProxy/notifyEnterFrame() at 
away3d.core.managers::Stage3DProxy/onEnterFrame()
```

Thank you!

data.title: altKey missing from TouchEvent
data.body:
Is the omission of altKey from TouchEvent deliberate?  Is there a way to get the state of the alt key when processing a TouchEvent on PC?

Thanks!
Ken

data.title: QuadBatches out of display list cause errors after starling.dispose()
data.body:
Quadbatches have this listener for restoring context. 
Starling.current.stage3D.addEventListener(Event.CONTEXT3D_CREATE, onContextCreated, false, 0, true);

It is removed in the dispose() method. However, if the quadbatch is not in the displaylist, calling starling.dispose() will not include the quadbatch and it will throw a missing context error when you create a new instance of starling (on the same stage3D).

This is a real issue for pooling displayobjects. One can of course just make them visible = false instead of removing them from the display list but that doesn't feel right.

This could be solved with a dispose event on Starling.current instead of parsing the display list.

data.title: ATF file format problem.
FragmentFilter needUpdate optimization doesn't work when scale != 1.0
data.body:
FragmentFilter checks texture size of cached texture (mPassTexture) and it it isn't changes skips texture update.
But there is a problem with texture size calculation if scale isn't equal to 1.0:
In texture.empty function texture size is calculated as int(originalWidth \* scale),
ConcreteTexture.width returns mWidth/mScale which is int(originalWidth \* scale) / scale which isn't always equals to originalWidth. This cause FragmentFilter optimization to be ignored.

data.title: Bad XML?
Add support for fluent api.
Optimizing BitmapFont's (and TextureAtlas's) XML parser
data.body:
If you read this Jackson Dunstan article it shows how storing strings from XML will actually keep the entire XML file around in memory as the master string. http://jacksondunstan.com/articles/2260

In BitmapFont.as this happens for mName's assignment in parseFontXml():

``` javascript
mName = fontXml.info.attribute("face");
trace( flash.sampler.getMasterString( mName ) ); //added this line to test theory
```

This will indeed show the entire contents of the xml file kept in memory for mName's master string.  Since it's not uncommon for games to have many bitmap fonts to account for different stylings and sizes, there are noticeable memory improvements here that are worth the ease of implementing the fix.  Here's the master string cleaner:

``` javascript
/**
*   Replace a string's "master string"-- the string it was built from--
*   with the string's first character to save memory
*   @param str String to clean
*   @return The input string, but with a single character master string
*   @author Jackson Dunstan, JacksonDunstan.com
*/
public static function cleanMasterString(str:String): String
{
    return str.substr(0,1)+str.substr(1);
}
```

The other simple improvement I see is to stop doing the E4X queries every iteration of the for each loops for chars and kernings.

``` javascript
for each (var charElement:XML in fontXml.chars.char)
```

becomes

``` javascript
var charElementsList : XMLList = fontXml.chars.char;
for each (var charElement:XML in charElementsList)
```

data.title: several BitmapData memory leaks
data.body: I noticed several BitmapData memory leaks in TouchMarker and MiniBitmapFont while profiling my app in Scout. So I investigated a bit more and noticed another non-disposed BitmapData object in TextField, although this one is not confirmed by Scout profiling. Thought I would share these quickfixes.

Fixed > AssetManager: Texture removed from mTextures when adding a font or atlas

data.title: AssetLoader Bug - Quick Fix
Build Error in BitmapFont - getCharIDs
data.body:
I am not sure if I am building with some old settings, but after updating from GitHub to get the latest sources, I now get a build error in getCharIDs in BitmapFont:

GitHub\Starling-Framework\starling\src\starling\text\BitmapFont.as(173): col: 21 Error: Implicit coercion of a value of type String to an unrelated type int.
            for(var key:int in mChars)
                    ^
Build halted with errors (fcsh).

"mChars" is a Dictionary, so I was suspecting a "for each" syntax here.

When I change to "for each (var key:int in mChars)" , the code compiles nicely. Is this an indication that I am compiling with the wrong compiler? (I am pretty sure I use FlexSDK 4.12.1, which should be ok?) 

I tried to find this error in the forums, but no one else seems to have it... Any ideas?

data.title: -changed some private vars to protected to be able to extend QuadBatch
data.body: I need to extend QuadBatch and want to be able to batch it with other QuadBatches.

data.title: A little optimization
Expose Button mContents so it would be easy to use image instead of text in it?
data.body:
Just a getter for mContents would be enough.

Of course using both image and text then would cause funky things, but the developer must know what she's doing.

data.title: Small optimization, mainly for IOS.
data.body: Optimization mainly for IOS, where hasEventListener check works much slower then on desktop.

data.title: Allow a Quad with a width/height of 0 (i.e. not throw an Error)
data.body:
I'm not sure how much work this is, or even if it's feasible, but if you don't ask you don't get :)

We use a lot of quads in our game to store as bgs etc, but sometimes, due to size errors (e.g. you use a quad as a bg for a Feathers Label, but when you create it, it might not be properly validated yet, so the width/height returns 0), it's created with a width and/or height of 0, resulting in a runtime error.

From what I can tell, Starling already supports display objects with no visible area, so would it be possible to add a Quad to this, if either the width or height is 0? It saves a lot of boilerplate `if( width == 0 ) width = 1` code checks everywhere (assuming that they _are_ everywhere)

data.title: AssetManager: Loading atlas XML without texture data
data.body: Would be handy if AssetManager could load atlas XML data even without enqueued texture data. So rather than discarding the atlas, it would put its data into your regular XML dictionary for later use. All this would be useful for preloading atlas XML data and then streaming ATF textures in real time without loading the XML each time you stream a texture.

data.title: TextureOptions.onReady overwritten by AssetManager
data.body:
When you set TextureOptions.onReady callback it won't ever fire because AssetManager   replaces it with its own onComplete function in line 710 of AssetManager.as:

``` actionscript
options.onReady = onComplete;
```

data.title: get characters in bitmap font
data.body: I need to know which character ids are registered in bitmap font. Writing a simple get method seems easier than manually parsing the XML passed into BitmapFont constructor.

data.title: AssetManager Function Private -> Protected
data.body: Hello! When using the SWC, I'd like to be able to override AssetManager.loadRawAsset for logging purposes. Could you please update the next version to have that function be protected rather than private? (For now I just copied the raw file and edited it locally, but I hate having a redundant file, especially in case of updates.) Thanks!
